qas.question: Which form of government did Galicia start using in 1975
Which modern group now works to attain Galicia status as a nation?

context: As part of the transition to <a0_0>democracy<a0_0/> upon the death of Franco in 1975, Galicia regained its status as an autonomous region within Spain with the Statute of Autonomy of 1981, which begins, "Galicia, historical nationality, is constituted as an Autonomous Community to access to its self-government, in agreement with the Spanish Constitution and with the present Statute (...)". Varying degrees of nationalist or independentist sentiment are evident at the political level. The <a1_0>Bloque Nacionalista Galego<a1_0/> or BNG, is a conglomerate of left-wing parties and individuals that claims Galician political status as a nation.
